question: What is the minimum age to participate?
answer: Participants must be 18 or over on Event Day. Younger participants can join the Mini London Marathon.

question: How can I update my personal details?
answer: You can update your details via your participant dashboard, accessible from your entry confirmation email.

question: Can I change my start time to run with a friend?
answer: You cannot move forward in your Start Area, but you may move back without notifying the organizers.

question: Will I receive a Participant Guide?
answer: Yes, it will be emailed to all participants several weeks before the event.

question: How do I apply for a Guinness World Records attempt?
answer: Visit the Guinness World Records website. The 2025 deadline is 17:00 GMT on 9 February 2025.

question: Are there pacers at the event?
answer: Yes, pacers will cover various target finish times. Details will be in the Participant Guide.

question: Can my family come with me to the start?
answer: No, unless they are also participating. Itâ€™s advised they do not travel to the start with you.

question: Can I take part in an exoskeleton?
answer: Yes, battery-operated robotic exoskeletons are allowed with up to four helpers.

question: Can I run with a Support Runner?
answer: Yes, if you have a disability or medical condition. You can apply for a free place for them.

question: How do I collect my Event Pack?
answer: Pick it up from the Running Show in London before the marathon. Packs are not mailed or available on race day.

question: Can someone else collect my Event Pack?
answer: Yes, they need your ID, written consent, and their own ID.

question: Will the marathon be broadcast live?
answer: Yes, it will be live on BBC platforms in the UK and in over 190 countries.

question: How do I view my event photos?
answer: Visit the results page and click the Sportograf button or go to sportograf.com.

question: Can I opt out of receiving a medal or T-shirt?
answer: Yes, you must opt in during registration. Opt-outs support sustainability efforts like tree planting.

question: Can I transfer my entry to someone else?
Is there an official app for tracking?
answer: Yes, the TCS London Marathon app will be available about 10 days before Event Day.

question: What if I can't participate on Marathon Day?
answer: You may be eligible to defer your place. Check the 'unable to take part' page for details.
